segments.text: I notice the dishes stacked neatly on the counter, waiting to be put away.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman seems to be in the middle of drying them, but she's so distracted.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder how long it will take her to finish the dishes with all the distractions.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water overflowing from the sink is creating a puddle that's getting closer to the dishes.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope the dishes don't get wet and slippery, causing an accident.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children's mischief is adding to the chaos, but the dishes remain neatly stacked.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a sense of satisfaction seeing the dishes so well-organized.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The scene is a mix of order and chaos, with the dishes representing the former.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the woman will ever get to finish putting away the dishes.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a sense of anticipation, wondering if the dishes will make it to the cabinets safely.
segments.speaker: PAR
